steps.text: Holy 💩 you nailed it! Or maybe you’ve heard about this, huh? Or maybe you are just a big Michael Jordan 🏀 fan… But still, it can be hard to believe it actually happens, right?

The chance that two people in the same room have the same birthday — that is the Birthday Paradox 🎉. And according to fancy math, there is a 50.7% chance when a room hits 23 people*. This is in a hypothetical world. In reality, you people aren’t born evenly throughout the year and it doesn’t count leap years, but the numbers are still pretty accurate.It may sound crazy, but like a lot of crazy things, it is simpler than it appears. And that is why it’s so cool.
Of course I can make you believe it. But we won’t look at formulas 🤓 or simulations 🤖, let’s grab the last 23 <mark>real people</mark> like you who just visited this site.

Boom! I told you it could happen. But that is just one instance, and it would be wrong of me to stop there. Because each time we get 23 people together, we have the same chance of a shared birthday. The more we repeat this, the more our count of it happening and it not happening we will even. That is the Law of Large Numbers in action.
